Executive Assistant Job at Nigerian Breweries Plc




        
    

        
        Nigerian Breweries Plc - As the foremost brewing company in Nigeria, we are proud of our vision to Wow Nigeria with our Great Brands, Passionate People and World Class Performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant 

Job Location: Lagos

In this role you will
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Deliver seamless executive support through effective diary, meeting, and travel management.
	Prepare and manage high-quality reports, presentations, and confidential correspondence.
	Coordinate MT engagements, ensuring thorough follow-up on key actions and priorities.
	Serve as a trusted liaison between the executives, internal teams, and external stakeholders.
	Uphold confidentiality and professionalism while managing sensitive information.
	Anticipate needs and proactively identify ways to enhance MT effectiveness and efficiency.
	If you would like the opportunity to work closely with senior leadership in the company, contribute meaningfully, learn continuously, and grow within a culture that inspires high performance, then this role is yours!


Key Accountabilities & Responsibilities


	Deliver seamless executive support through effective diary, meeting, and travel management.
	Prepare and manage high-quality reports, presentations, and confidential correspondence.
	Coordinate MT engagements, ensuring thorough follow-up on key actions and priorities.
	Serve as a trusted liaison between the executives, internal teams, and external stakeholders.
	Uphold confidentiality and professionalism while managing sensitive information.
	Anticipate needs and proactively identify ways to enhance MT effectiveness and efficiency.


Requirements
Educational qualifications:


	Bachelor’s degree in any discipline with a minimum of Second-Class Lower


Work Experience:


	At least 3 years of corporate experience in business operations, office management, event management and customer service
	At least 3 years of proven experience supporting senior leaders in a dynamic environment


Skills:


	Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with strong attention to detail.
	High proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
	Strong organizational and multitasking capabilities with the ability to manage competing priorities.
	Proactive, resourceful, and dependable with a strong sense of initiative.
	Demonstrated discretion, integrity, and sound judgment in handling confidential matters.
	Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to build strong professional relationships.

Customer Service Representative Job at Elite Logistics & Development Services Limited




        
    

        
        Elite Logistics & Development Services Limited is an indigenous company with its operating office in Lagos and is duly registered under the Companies and Allied Matters Act 1990 with RC1195367. ELADS Limited prides itself on meeting modern-day civil engineering, construction and general contracts administration challenges and ensuring the timely, successful completion of projects.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Elite Logistics & Development Services Limited strives to conduct its business fairly and honestly with consideration for the long-term needs of all its stakeholders. Competitive tendering, professional management, quality construction, an excellent safety record, a proven ability, cooperative and proactive approach have ensured our delivery of the highest quality workmanship and client satisfaction in both the public and private sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Representative

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job brief


	We are looking for a customer-oriented service representative.


What does a Customer Service Representative do?


	A Customer Service Representative, or CSR, will act as a liaison, provide product/services information, answer questions, and resolve any emerging problems that our customer accounts might face with accuracy and efficiency.
	The best CSRs are genuinely excited to help customers. They’re patient, empathetic, and passionately communicative.
	They love to talk and understand the value of good communication skills. Customer service representatives can put themselves in their customers’ shoes and advocate for them when necessary. Customer feedback is priceless, and these CSRs can gather that for you. Problem-solving also comes naturally to customer care specialists.
	They are confident in troubleshooting and investigating if they don’t have enough information to answer customer questions or resolve complaints.
	The target is to ensure excellent service standards, respond efficiently to customer inquiries and maintain high customer satisfaction.


Responsibilities
Customer Service Responsibilities list:


	Manage large amounts of incoming phone calls
	Generate sales leads
	Identify and assess customers’ needs to achieve satisfaction
	Build sustainable relationships and trust with customer accounts through open and interactive communication
	Provide accurate, valid and complete information by using the right methods/tools
	Meet personal/customer service team sales targets and call handling quotas
	Handle customer complaints, provide appropriate solutions and alternatives within the time limits; follow up to ensure resolution
	Keep records of customer interactions, process customer accounts and file documents
	Follow communication procedures, guidelines and policies
	Take the extra mile to engage customers.


Requirements and skills


	High School Diploma.
	Proven customer support experience or experience as a Client Service Representative
	Track record of over-achieving quota
	Strong phone contact handling skills and active listening
	Familiarity with CRM systems and practices
	Customer orientation and ability to adapt/respond to different types of characters
	Excellent communication and presentation skills
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively.


Salary
N80,000 - N150,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: elitelogisticdevelopment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Nigerian College of Agribusiness
content:
The Nigerian College of Agribusiness provides specialized education that drives improved productivity and performance in the agricultural sector in Africa. Established in 2020 and approved by the National Board for Technical Education, NCA is pioneering action learning for the acceleration of skills development in commercial agricultural production, innovative food processing, agribusiness trade and development leadership, NCA is pioneering action learning for the acceleration of skills development in commercial agricultural production, innovative food processing, agribusiness trade and development leadership. Our mission is to cultivate a vibrant, sustainable and profitable agribusiness sector that drives economic growth and social progress across Africa and beyond.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Head of Business

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Job type: Full-time (Onsite)

About the Role


	The Nigerian College of Agribusiness (NCA) is recruiting a dynamic, commercially minded, and results driven professional for the position of Head of Business.
	This senior leadership role is responsible for driving enrollments, marketing, business development, partnerships, and revenue growth across all academic and professional programs of the College.
	The ideal candidate must be vibrant, confident, strategic, and capable of generating strong numbers through innovative outreach and market engagement.


Key Responsibilities


	Drive student enrollments across all NCA postgraduate, professional, and certification programs
	Lead national and regional marketing campaigns, digital promotions, and brand visibility
	Build, manage, and expand partnerships with farms, agribusinesses, ministries, NGOs, and private sector organisations
	Develop and execute business strategies that increase revenue for the College and its Centres
	Manage the full enrollment funnel: lead generation, nurturing, conversion, onboarding, and retention
	Coordinate national outreach activities for South West, South South, and Northern Nigeria training hubs
	Identify new business opportunities, corporate training prospects, and institutional partnerships
	Represent NCA at conferences, exhibitions, workshops, and partnership meetings
	Oversee marketing budgets, content planning, and digital communication channels
	Conduct market research to support new programs and emerging training needs
	Provide weekly, monthly, and quarterly business performance reports
	Work closely with the Head of Programs to align growth strategies with program delivery capacity
	Ensure efficient and professional communication across all student and corporate touchpoints


Requirements
Essential Requirements:


	Bachelor’s Degree (Master’s degree is an added advantage)
	Strong background in sales, enrollment management, marketing, or business development
	Proven track record of hitting growth targets in education, training, consulting, or similar industries
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and public speaking skills
	Ability to lead initiatives, convert leads, and drive revenue independently
	Vibrant, proactive, entrepreneurial, and able to work without supervision
	Must reside in or be willing to relocate to Ibadan or willing to relocate.
	Ability to travel nationally as required for business engagements


Desirable Skills:


	Experience with higher education enrollments or professional training markets
	Familiarity with digital marketing tools and conversion funnels
	Experience building public and private sector partnerships
	Ability to conceptualize and execute new business ideas


Method of Application 
Interested and quaified candidates should send their CV and detailed Cover Letters to: careers@ncaedu.ng using "Application – Head of Business" as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Finance & Admin Officer

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Job type: Full-time (Onsite)

About the Role


	The Nigerian College of Agribusiness (NCA) is seeking a diligent, trustworthy, and highly organised professional for the position of Finance & Admin Officer. This role is central to the smooth financial and administrative operation of the College and supports both academic and professional programs.
	The ideal candidate must be accurate, disciplined, results oriented, and capable of managing finance and administrative processes with minimal supervision. Integrity is critical.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage all financial transactions including invoicing, receipts, and payment confirmations for academic and professional programs
	Handle weekly and monthly reconciliation of bank statements, tuition payments, and program revenues
	Maintain accurate financial records, ledgers, and documentation for audits and reporting
	Manage petty cash, procurement, and expense tracking within approved limits
	Prepare monthly income and expenditure reports, including centre-specific revenue reports
	Assist with budgeting, financial planning, and program cost analysis
	Handle administrative functions including staff records, document filing, and office coordination
	Support student onboarding by providing payment guidance and administrative documentation
	Support logistics and operations during academic and professional training programs
	Ensure compliance with internal financial controls and reporting standards
	Maintain vendor relationships and process vendor payments
	Prepare financial inputs for weekly, monthly, and quarterly institutional reports


Requirements
Essential Requirements:


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	Proficiency in bookkeeping, account reconciliation, and financial documentation
	Strong Microsoft Excel skills and basic proficiency in accounting tools or software
	High level of integrity, transparency, and ethical conduct
	Excellent organisational and administrative skills
	Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks efficiently
	Must be residing in or willing to relocate to Ibadan or its environs
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy under pressure


Desirable Skills:


	Experience working with educational institutions, training organisations, NGOs, or professional bodies
	Experience preparing financial reports or supporting audits
	Familiarity with digital payment systems and CRM tools
	Experience handling procurement and expense control


Method of Application 
Interested and quaified candidates should send their CV and detailed Cover Letters to: careers@ncaedu.ng using "Application – Finance & Admin Officer" as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Business Development Executive

Job Locations: Abuja, Kaduna, Lagos, Ibadan - Oyo, Benin - Edo, and Port Harcourt - Rivers
Job type: Full-time (Onsite)

About the Role


	The Nigerian College of Agribusiness (NCA) is recruiting energetic, ambitious, and results-driven professionals for the role of Business Development Executive (BDE) across two strategic regions: North and South.
	This is a field-focused business role responsible for driving program enrollments, regional partnerships, corporate outreach, and market expansion for all NCA programs.
	The ideal candidates must be proactive, confident, excellent communicators, and passionate about agribusiness, education, and market development. These roles form the backbone of NCA’s national expansion system.


Additional Information:


	Business Development Executive – North Region: (Based in Abuja or Kaduna; covers NW, NE, and NC states)
	Business Development Executive – South Region: (Based in Lagos, Ibadan, Benin, or Port Harcourt; covers SW, SS, and SE states)


Key Responsibilities


	Drive student and participant enrollments for all NCA professional programs
	Conduct regional outreach to farms, agribusinesses, ministries, ADPs, NGOs, cooperatives, and universities
	Represent NCA in local engagements, exhibitions, field visits, and cluster mobilization
	Manage and grow regional WhatsApp communities and digital outreach channels
	Execute corporate and institutional partnership strategies in collaboration with the Head of Business
	Identify local training opportunities, corporate engagements, and sponsored program possibilities
	Coordinate basic logistics during field events and trainings within the assigned region
	Conduct regular market research to identify new opportunities for NCA programs
	Prepare weekly and monthly performance reports on leads, conversions, and partnerships
	Strengthen NCA’s regional presence and brand visibility
	Support the Head of Business in meeting revenue and enrollment targets


Requirements
Essential Requirements:


	Bachelor’s Degree in any field (Marketing, Agriculture, Business, or Social Sciences is an advantage)
	Strong experience in sales, field marketing, community outreach, or business development
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and persuasive skills
	Familiarity with agribusiness environments, value chains, NGOs, or agricultural clusters (added advantage)
	Strong digital marketing and WhatsApp engagement skills
	High confidence, energy, and ability to work independently with minimum supervision
	Must reside in the region of application (North or South)
	Willingness to travel within the assigned region when necessary


Desirable Skills:


	Experience in higher education enrollment or training sectors
	Experience engaging Ministries, Departments & Agencies (MDAs), NGOs, or cooperatives
	Ability to build relationships quickly and convert leads to enrollment
	Good presentation and public speaking ability


What We Offer


	Opportunity to be part of a growing national institution
	Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
	Clear career growth pathways as NCA expands across Nigeria
	Supportive and dynamic work culture.


Method of Application 
Interested and quaified candidates should send their CV and detailed Cover Letters to: careers@ncaedu.ng clearly indicating the region they are applying for (North or South) as the subject of the email. E.g Application – Business Development Executive (North or South).

title: Job Vacancies at Solar Nigachem
content:
Solar Nigachem stands out as a reliable and trustworthy partner. Our unparalleled expertise, commitment to safety, cutting-edge technology, and customer-centric approach makes us a go-to provider for the following sectors, Mining, road construction, Defense projects, Quarries, Seismic Exploration, Tunneling, Hydro Projects and all others - our customized solutions and exceptional customer support ensure that our clients receive the highest level of assistance and satisfaction. With Solar Nigachem, mining operations can rely on their explosives to enhance productivity, efficiency, and safety, ultimately contributing to the success and sustainability of the mining industry.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



1.) Engineering and Maintenance Manager

Job Location: Owode, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Manage and oversee daily engineering and maintenance operations across mechanical, electrical, utilities, and fabrication units in alignment with departmental plans from the HOD Engineering.
	Develop and implement Preventive Maintenance (PM) and Predictive Maintenance (PdM) schedules.
	Respond promptly to equipment breakdowns, lead troubleshooting activities, and ensure timely restoration of production equipment.
	Maintain accurate documentation, including machine history files, maintenance logs, equipment performance records, and work permits.
	Plan and supervise installation, modification, and upgrading of machines, ensuring that all engineering projects meet safety and technical specifications.
	Monitor equipment performance, analyze failure trends, and implement long-term corrective and reliability-centered solutions to minimize downtime.
	Supervise major repairs, including equipment overhauls, and commissioning of new installations with supervision of the HOD engineering.
	Conduct routine hazard identification, risk assessments, and safety inspections, ensuring full compliance with HSE procedures, engineering safety standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Verify quality of maintenance work, ensuring all repairs, replacements, and installations meet engineering and production quality standards.
	Collaborate with the Engineering Store Supervisor to ensure availability of critical spare parts, proper inventory control, and adherence to cost-effective materials management.
	Supervise engineering personnel, including technicians, mechanics, electricians, and utilities staff; provide coaching, discipline, and performance management.
	Support technical competence development, ensuring that engineers and technicians receive continuous training in equipment maintenance, safety, and technical upgrades.
	Assist in preparingthe engineering reports (breakdown analyses, maintenance performance, reliability statistics, and improvement recommendations) alongside the HOD Engineering and submit to themanagement for informed decision-making.


Job Requirements


	Applicant should have minimum of B.Sc Degree in Mechanical Engineering
	7 - 10 years of engineering/maintenance experience in a manufacturing or chemical industry, with at least 3 years in a supervisory or managerial role.
	NSE or COREN (Preferred); HSE Level 3; Certification in equipment maintenance or reliability engineering is an added advantage.
	Mechanical systems maintenance, preventive & predictive maintenance, troubleshooting, reliability engineering, project planning & execution, utilities management (boilers, compressors, generators), engineering drawings, technical documentation, and equipment commissioning.
	Strong leadership and team management ability; excellent communication skills; analytical thinking; problem-solving; decision-making; attention to detail; time management; high safety consciousness; integrity and accountability.


Salary
N300,000 - N400,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 31st December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume to: hr@solarnigachem.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Forklift Operator

Job Location: Obafemi Owode, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Operate Forklift to load and unload products within the Factory.
	Safely transport materials between Magazines, Production and Designated areas
	Perform routine and pre-operational inspection andmaintenance and Cleaning of the Forklift.
	Adhere to all factory safety policies, traffic rules and operational guidelines
	Use appropriate PPE ( Personal Protective Equipment) while operating forklift
	Maintain accurate logs of forklift operations, movement of Goods and fuel usage
	Support documentation of loading/unloading activities when required.
	Report any equipment faults, malfunctions or maintenance needs promptly
	Assist in inventory checks and provide reports on materials handled.


Qualification and Requirements


	SSCE or OND or NCE or similar qualifacation
	A minimum of 3 - 5 years of work experience as a forklift Operator in a manufacturing or warehouse environment
	Ability to maintain accurate logs of forklift operations
	Adhere strictly to Factory and HSE safety procedures
	Ability to conduct Pre-Operational inspections of forklift before use to ensure proper functionality
	Communication: Communicate or report any finding regarding maintenance isses on the forklift to the supervisor.


Salary
N85,000 - N100,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 11th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@solarnigachem.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Hiab Driver

Job Location: Obafemi Owode, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Support Logistics Operations by assisting in the movement and placement of heavy materials
	Operate Hiab truck in a safe manner with regulatory guidelines
	Adhere to all safety and Operational policies when loading goods
	Conduct daily pre-operational inspections of the Hiab and lifting equipment
	Carry out routine maintenance checks and report faults promptly to the supervisor
	Complete and file daily vehicle checklists and operation logs accurately
